itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, October 21, 2013
title: Hackers find vulnerability in system that tracks shipping vessels
teaser: Fake radio signals can be used to make ships that don't exist appear on the tracking system.
description: Fake radio signals can be used to make ships that don't exist appear on the tracking system.

Cybersecurity researchers have figured out how to get into the system used to track some 400,000 shipping vessels around the world. Since the system isn't protected, hackers could potentially use it to make ghost ships appear and even fake emergency alerts. Chester Wisniewski, of the cybersecurity firm Sophos, tells Marketplace Tech host Ben Johnson about the vulnerability.

contentencoded: Cybersecurity researchers have figured out how to get into the system used to track some 400,000 shipping vessels around the world. Since the system isn't protected, hackers could potentially use it to make ghost ships appear and even fake emergency alerts. Chester Wisniewski, of the cybersecurity firm Sophos, tells Marketplace Tech host Ben Johnson about the vulnerability.
